articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), first chairman of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun at 00:00 on Thursday, the nation's greatest memorial day.
					 Kim Jong Un entered the hall where the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il are standing. 
					
					 The chief of a guard of honor of the Ground, Naval, Air and Anti-Air Forces of the KPA and the Worker-Peasant Red Guards made a salute towards the statues.
					
					 A floral basket in the name of Kim Jong Un was placed before the statues.
					
					 Also laid there was a floral basket in the joint name of the KPA. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un together with the participants paid high tribute to the statues in humble reverence.
					
					 He entered the immortality hall where Kim Jong Il lies in state. 
					
					 He together with the participants paid respectful homage and made bow to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He went round the hall where orders Kim Jong Il received are on display, the mourners' hall and halls which house a car, electric car, boat and train coach used by him. 
					
					 He was accompanied by commanding officers of the KPA.

articles.title: Message to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of C.C. Communist Party of Russian Federation
articles.content:
Message to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of C.C. Communist Party of Russian Federation
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), received a message from G. A. Zhuganov, chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, on Thursday.
					 The message said the Korean people are recalling the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The WPK is leading the Korean people to the road indicated by Kim Jong Un, the message noted, adding:
					
					 Plans for the development in the fields of industry, agriculture, science and culture are being realized. 
					
					 The DPRK is paying deep attention to increasing defence capabilities to cope with the ceaseless provocation by the outside forces.
					
					 We are convinced that the Korean people will confidently advance along the road chosen by them. 
					
					 We reiterate solidarity and support for your country.

articles.title: Message to Kim Jong Un from Nigerian President
articles.content:
Message to Kim Jong Un from Nigerian President
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message from Muhammadu Buhari, president of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, on November 20.
					 In the message the president said on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of HE Generalissimo Kim Jong Il, he extends the deepest respect to Kim Jong Il, the great leader, and expresses firm solidarity with Kim Jong Un and the friendly people of the DPRK on behalf of the government and people of the Federal Republic of Nigeria and on his own behalf.
					
					 Kim Jong Il will live forever as an outstanding leader of matchless grit as he performed the undying feats for defending the socialist cause and turning the great DPRK into an independent country, the message said.
					
					 The message expressed hope that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations with a long history and tradition will grow stronger in all fields.

articles.title: Message to Kim Jong Un from Ugandan President
articles.content:
Message to Kim Jong Un from Ugandan President
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message from Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of the Republic of Uganda, on December 3.
					 In the message the president said that he recollects together with Kim Jong Un and the Korean people the shining exploits performed by Kim Jong Il, eternal leader of the Korean people, for the Koreans and other people of the world on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of the sudden and sorrowful demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il devoted his great life of dedication to the politico-economic and social development of the DPRK, the message said, adding his exploits will last forever.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits for World Cause of Socialism
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits for World Cause of Socialism
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- On the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il, peoples in the DPRK and the world look back on the feats performed by him in guiding the global cause of socialism to victory.
					 The world socialist movement was in peril in the period of the late 1980s-early 1990s. At that time communist and workers' parties of some countries abandoned their faith in socialism as it collapsed in East European countries.
					
					 Under this situation, leader Kim Jong Il had conducted his energetic ideo-theoretical activities to arouse the world revolutionary parties to the struggle for defending and advancing the socialist cause.
					
					 He authored such celebrated works as "The Historical Lesson in Building Socialism and the General Line of Our Party", "On the Fundamentals of Revolutionary Party Building" and "Abuses of Socialism Are Intolerable" in the early 1990s to point out why socialism collapsed in some countries, review the historical lessons in building socialism and indicate the path of socialism.
					
					 His work "Socialism Is a Science", published on November 1, 1994, threw the world into a great excitement. The world progressives praised it as a "'Communist Manifesto' in the present times" and a beacon of hope, hardening their will to activate the socialist movement.
					
					 Thanks to his deep care and energetic efforts, the Pyongyang Declaration "Let Us Defend and Advance the Cause of Socialism" was adopted on April 20, 1992, with approval of the representatives of 70 political parties from the world. The Declaration elaborates on the principles, tasks and ways for defending and advancing the cause of socialism on the basis of the Juche theory on socialist ideology.
					
					 Since then, an increasing number of political parties throughout the world have signed the Pyongyang Declaration one after another in support of it.
					
					 In this regard, VOA said that the Pyongyang Declaration calling for the revival of socialism is a source of trouble more serious than the DPRK's ballistic missile and that it may bring a fatal calamity to the U.S. new world strategy sooner or later.
					
					 The revolutionary parties of the world still venerate Kim Jong Il as their honorary chairmen while regarding his works as their must documents and a guide for party construction and activity.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Niger
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Niger
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Mahamadou Issoufou, president of the Republic of Niger, on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the proclamation of the republic.
					 The message wished the president and people of Niger bigger successes in their work for national unity and socio-economic development, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Senior Party, State Officials Pay Homage to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Senior Party, State Officials Pay Homage to Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and other senior party and state officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, members of the party central leadership organ in Pyongyang and officials of party and power organs, the Cabinet, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Thursday, the nation's greatest memorial day.
					 Seen standing before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il was a floral basket in the name of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also seen there was a floral basket in the name of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Placed there was a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet.
					
					 The participants paid tribute to the statues of the great leaders.
					
					 At the immortality hall where Kim Jong Il lies in state they made bows to him.
					
					 They went round the hall where orders Kim Jong Il received are on display and halls which house a car, electric car, boat and train coach used by him during his field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of his life. 
					
					 On the same day servicepersons and people of all social strata visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay homage to Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Foreign Guests, Overseas Koreans Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Foreign Guests, Overseas Koreans Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Foreign diplomatic envoys, representatives of international organizations and military attaches here and other foreign guests and overseas Koreans staying here visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Thursday, the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 They paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il before their statues. 
					
					 At the immortality hall where Kim Jong Il lies in state they made bows to him.
					
					 They went round the hall where orders Kim Jong Il received are on display and halls which house a car, electric car, boat and train coach used by him during his field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of his life. 
					
					 The chief and staff members of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front also visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay tribute to him on the same day.

articles.title: Foreign Crewmen Remember Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Crewmen Remember Kim Jong Il
Nampho, December 17 (KCNA) -- Foreign crewmen met at Nampho Port on Thursday in commemoration of the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The participants laid a floral basket before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in Nampho City and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Present there were the captain and crewmen of the Panama-flagged ship Iast Pros Perity.            .
					
					 Speakers said that they came to recollect the exploits of Kim Jong Il who developed the human thought with his outstanding ideological and theoretical activities and original Songun politics and firmly defended socialism.
					
					 They said that the DPRK is demonstrating its dignity as the politico-ideological and military power thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Il who led the confrontation with imperialism and the U.S. to victory.
					
					 They stressed that Kim Jong Il was the prominent leader and tender-hearted father of the people who dedicated his all to the country's prosperity, people's happiness, world peace and accomplishment of the cause of independence all his life.
					
					 They expressed their firm belief that the Korean people would certainly triumph in their just cause for building a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: High Tribute Paid to Kim Jong Il in DPRK
articles.content:
High Tribute Paid to Kim Jong Il in DPRK
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Service personnel and people across the country honored the memory of leader Kim Jong Il in the humblest reverence on Thursday, the fourth anniversary of his demise.
					 Service personnel, working people of all strata and school youth and children visited the plaza of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun, the sacred temple of Juche, in an endless stream. 
					
					 They paid tribute before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Service personnel, working people from all walks of life and school youth and children visited the statues of the great leaders and portraits depicting their smiling images in different parts of the country to pay the humblest tribute to them.
					
					 There took place remembrance concerts by artistes, youth and students and women's union members in North Phyongan, South Hwanghae, North Hwanghae, Kangwon, South Hamgyong provinces and other places.
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the sacred revolutionary career and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il who demonstrated the dignity and might of Songun Korea to the world.
					
					 Youth and students and persons who had the honor of being received by Kim Jong Il across the country held remembrance meetings. 
					
					 Oath-taking meetings took place by working people's organizations in different parts of the country.

articles.title: DPRK People Filled with Deep Yearning for Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
DPRK People Filled with Deep Yearning for Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- All the people in the DPRK are ardently yearning for leader Kim Jong Il with the 4th anniversary of his demise (December 17) as an occasion.
					 At dawn of Thursday citizens from different walks of life were seen visiting the Mansu Hill in Pyongyang to pay floral tributes to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il with their deep yearning.
					
					 Such scenes were also observed in other parts of the country where the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il are standing.
					
					 Over the past four years since the demise of Kim Jong Il, the Korean people have worked hard to implement his behests, overcoming their bitter grief and sorrow.
					
					 Kim Kyong Suk, a staff of the Kwangbok Area Supermarket, told KCNA with tears in her eyes:
					
					 Though he was in bad health condition, leader Kim Jong Il visited the supermarket on December 15, 2011, two days before his demise. And he was very pleased to see every counter filled with goods, saying citizens would like them.
					
					 We will always remember the great life of the leader who devoted his all only to the wellbeing and happiness of the people, making a ceaseless journey of field guidance despite weather conditions.
					
					 O Phil Sun, a saleswoman of Pyongyang Department Store No. 1, said:
					
					 Still fresh in my memory is a smiling image of the leader when he visited the department store in hot weather to see a commodity exhibition.
					
					 He had worked heart and soul for the improvement of the people's living standard, finding his pleasure in the people's happiness.
					
					 Choe Song Guk, section chief of the Hana Musical Information Centre, said:
					
					 He had continued his journey of field guidance for the people's better life until the last moments of his life.
					
					 Despite the biting weather on Dec. 15, 2011, he visited the center to provide the citizens with better cultural living conditions, seeing to it that people could use the music pieces personally collected by him.
					
					 True to his lifetime intention, we will produce much more products popular among the people.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Service personnel, people from all walks of life and school youth and children visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and portraits of the smiling great leaders in different parts of the country on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of Kim Jong Il's demise.
					 Seen standing before the statues of the great leaders on Mansu Hill was a floral basket sent by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Placed before the statues were floral baskets in the names of the party, armed forces and power bodies, public organizations, ministries and national institutions, units of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, institutions, enterprises, factories, farms and schools at all levels in the city, and bouquets and flowers.
					
					 Also placed there was a floral basket in the name of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front.
					
					 People paid tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Floral baskets in the names of units of the Korean People's Army, institutions and enterprises, bouquets and flowers were placed before the statues of the great leaders and portraits of their smiling images in different parts of the capital city of Pyongyang including Kim Il Sung University, Kim Il Sung Military University, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security and the Mansudae Art Studio.
					
					 Service personnel, working people and school youth and children paid floral tribute to the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu before their statues and portraits of their smiling images in their residential quarters.

articles.title: Switzerland-Korea Committee Sends Floral Basket to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Switzerland-Korea Committee Sends Floral Basket to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- A floral basket sent by the Switzerland-Korea Committee was placed before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Thursday, the fourth demise anniversary of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Concert Observes Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Concert Observes Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- A concert "People's Yearning" was given at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre Thursday, the fourth demise anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Among the audience were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and other senior party, state and army officials, officials from armed forces organs, the Cabinet, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, those from city organs, persons who had the honor of being received by the great leaders and those of distinguished feats.
					
					 Overseas compatriots staying in the homeland, the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of the international bodies and military attaches and their spouses here were invited to watch the concert.
					
					 The hymn for immortality of the leader "Boundless Is Our Yearning" resounded throughout the theatre in the form of a symphonic poem at the concert.
					
					 Put on the stage were piano concerto "Ode to Comrade Kim Jong Il" and the fifth movement "Appearing in the East and in the West, It's the Anti-Japanese Guerilla Style" of symphonic suite "O Korea, I Will Add Glory to Thee", an immortal classic masterpiece.
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the revolutionary life of Kim Jong Il who demonstrated the dignity and power of Songun Korea, covering an untrodden and unexplored path with his total dedication to the country and its people.
					
					 Female chorus "Song of Love for People" and mixed quintet "Oh, My Motherland of Songun" were put on the stage to praise the country shining with Kim Jong Il's patriotic exploits.
					
					 It truthfully represented the immutable faith of the service personnel and people of the DPRK to usher in a heyday of the great Paektusan nation under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un, holding higher the red flag of Juche associated with the sacred life of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Great Devotion to Happiness of People
articles.content:
Great Devotion to Happiness of People
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- On the occasion of the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il, people in the DPRK look back on his great life dedicated to the wellbeing of the people.
					 It was one day of January Juche 87 (1998) that he arrived in Jagang Province to give field guidance to over 20 units of the province. An official informed him of the weather at the height of winter cold, rough topographical conditions and the state of road frozen by heavy snowfall. Nevertheless, he left for the units, saying he had to lead the people to the final victory in the forced march.
					
					 In December 2011 when the country saw the heaviest snowfall in 60 years, he inspected different units in South Hamgyong Province to give highly important instructions to improve the provincial work.
					
					 The next legs of his journey were military units, the Hana Musical Information Centre, the Kwangbok Area Supermarket and others.
					
					 Even in the evening of December 16, 2011, one day before his demise, he took measures for the supply of fish to Pyongyang citizens before taking a train to continue his inspection tour.

articles.title: Papers Call for Thoroughly Carrying out Kim Jong Il's Behests
articles.content:
Papers Call for Thoroughly Carrying out Kim Jong Il's Behests
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK's leading newspapers Thursday editorially mark the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Rodong Sinmun says the beaming image of Kim Jong Il is the source of the invincible might of the servicepersons and people which inspires them with conviction and optimism while his behests represent the banner of everlasting victory and prosperity of the country.
					
					 The paper goes on:
					
					 His behests are the vivid expression of his lifetime mission of giving priority to the people and respecting and loving them.
					
					 He worked heart and soul, with his heart ablaze with enthusiasm and love throughout his life, with inexhaustible energy to protect the destiny of the people and provide them with happiness.
					
					 The history of his forced march which he made even on holidays and his birthdays for the future of the country is a great epic of heroic self-sacrifice which would touch everyone to tears.
					
					 He is still alive in the hearts of the people as he performed great exploits for the people huge enough to fill the sea and reach the sky, being exposed to all hardships suffered by a revolutionary and a human being.
					
					 Today, Marshal Kim Jong Un holds fast to his idea and behests as the eternal guidelines of the revolution and arouses all the servicepersons and people to the struggle for implementing them.
					
					 Kim Jong Un carries on the forced march associated with the epic of prioritizing the people's interests and respecting and loving them and ushers in a new history of remarkable creation and changes in which mountains and rivers are changed in a year, not in a decade, and a great change is made day after day.
					
					 The paper calls for building the greatest power and a paradise of the people where the behests of Kim Jong Il are translated into a reality under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Minju Joson editorially calls for bringing earlier the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche by carrying forward the idea and cause of Kim Jong Il, single-mindedly united around Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Fascist Action against S. Korean Workers' Struggle Denounced
articles.content:
Fascist Action against S. Korean Workers' Struggle Denounced
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- The minister of Employment and Labor of south Korea at a meeting on December 14 branded the general strike to be staged by the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) as an "illegal one" and said it would strictly cope with it, according to the south Korean KBS.
					 This reckless remark is a vivid expression of the dictatorial nature of the present ruling forces as it takes no thought of why the workers are compelled to stage a general strike.
					
					 The south Korean people of all social strata are waging the protest actions everywhere as they cannot bear any more the ceaseless disasters and ever more undisguised misrule against the people.
					
					 But the ruling forces are countering the actions with the merciless suppression instead of lending an ear to the voice of the people.

articles.title: Petition against "State-compiled" History Textbook Presented to UN
articles.content:
Petition against "State-compiled" History Textbook Presented to UN
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- South Korean youth and children filed a petition against the introduction of "state-compiled" history textbook to the UN Human Rights Council.
					 A meeting took place in this regard in Seoul under the sponsorship of the "Action of Youth and Children against State-compiled Textbook" on December 12. 
					
					 A "petition addressed to UN in demand of withdrawal of state-compiled textbook" was read out at the meeting. 
					
					 It denounced the authorities for trampling down the people's action against the introduction of "state-compiled" history textbook with violence. 
					
					 It said there is high danger the "state-compiled" history textbook will be used as a political tool, adding it will eulogize pro-Japanese acts and dictatorship. 
					
					 It requested the UN to investigate illegal and inhumane behavior that was manifested in the moves to introduce the "state-compiled" history textbook and force the south Korean "government" to withdraw the introduction. 
					
					 At the end of the meeting the participants conducted propaganda activities.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Cambodia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Cambodia
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- A Cambodian committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed on Dec. 13.
					 Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace, was elected chairman of the committee at the instructions of King Norodom Sihamoni.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to immortal exploits performed by Kim Jong Il and organize political and cultural events on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Different Countries
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings, photo exhibitions and film shows took place in Bangladesh, Mongolia and Spain on Dec. 8 and 10 on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos dealing with his revolutionary career.
					
					 Also on display there were photos showing the achievements made by the service personnel and people of the DPRK in building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 "DPRK Tells in Bitter Tears" and other Korean films were screened at film shows.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, the president of the Bangladesh People's League and other speakers praised Kim Jong Il for turning the DPRK into a political and ideological power and military power remaining unfazed despite any challenge and move of the imperialists with his ever-victorious Songun politics.
					
					 The chairman of the Mongolia-Democratic Korea Friendship Bridge Association said that Kim Jong Il is the great master in ideology and theory, adding that his profound ideas serve as a valuable treasured sword to be followed and embodied not only by the Mongolian people but by world progressives.
					
					 The chairman of the Spanish committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il and other speakers praised him as the great politician and iron-willed Songun commander who beat back all challenges and aggression moves of the imperialists with his Songun politics and turned the DPRK into a full-fledged nuclear weapons state, providing a solid foundation for building a thriving nation.
					
					 A message to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting held in Spain.

articles.title: Korean Film Shows Held in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Korean Film Shows Held in Foreign Countries
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Film shows were held by the Algerian National Liberation Front Party and at companies of Nigeria and Thailand on December 8 and 9 on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Films shown included Korean films documenting the revolutionary career of Kim Jong Il and showing the struggle of servicepersons and people of the DPRK for building a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: DPRK's Holidays Marked in Czech Republic
articles.content:
DPRK's Holidays Marked in Czech Republic
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- A seminar took place in the Czech Republic on Dec. 3 on the occasions of the 24th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army, 4th anniversary of Marshal Kim Jong Un's assumption of the same post and the 98th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 Present at the seminar were figures of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association and the Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea and other people.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to the Czech Republic and members of his embassy.
					
					 The participants laid bouquets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Jaroslav Kafka, chairman of the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association, said:
					
					 The DPRK could victoriously advance by smashing the moves of the imperialist reactionaries including the U.S. against socialism and working the world-startling miracles as Kim Jong Il pursued the Songun politics.
					
					 It has turned into a military power and a socialist fortress which no imperialist dares provoke as Kim Jong Un is successfully carrying forward Kim Jong Il's revolutionary cause of Songun.
					
					 Indeed, Kim Jong Un's assumption of the post of the supreme commander of the KPA is a great event firmly guaranteeing the victories of socialist construction in the DPRK and the cause of global independence.

articles.title: DPRK Books Donated to Nigerian Universities
articles.content:
DPRK Books Donated to Nigerian Universities
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and DPRK books were donated to Nigeria.
					 Book-donating ceremonies took place at University of Abuja and Teacher Training College of Abuja of Nigeria on Dec. 11.
					
					 Present at the ceremonies were figures of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy and the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Songun Politics and teachers and students of the university and college.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Germany
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Germany
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" was published in booklet by a German publishing house.
					 The work, published on July 26, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the essence of Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his noble life of loving the country and people. It clarifies the important issues arising in embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					
					 A work releasing ceremony was held at the publishing house on Dec. 11.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del IV aniversario del fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, visito a la hora 0 del dia 17, dia de maxima recordacion nacional, el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan.
					El Mariscal entro en el salon donde se encuentran las estatuas de pie de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il.
					
					El jefe de la guardia de honor de las fuerzas terrestres, navales, aereas y antiaereas del EPC y del Ejercito Rojo Obrero-Campesino dio el parte de recepcion hacia las estatuas de pie.
					
					Fueron colocados ante las estatuas un cesto de flores en nombre del Mariscal y el otro en nombre del EPC.
					
					Junto con los participantes, el Mariscal rindio homenaje postumo a los Generalisimos ante sus estatuas de pie y al Dirigente en el salon de eternidad donde esta conservado su cuerpo.
					
					El Mariscal recorrio la sala de conservacion de ordenes recibidas por el Dirigente, el hall de llantos y las salas de conservacion de auto, carro electrico, barco y vagon de tren usados por el. 
					
					Le acompanaron los miembros de mando del EPC.

articles.title: Declaracion de vocero de MINREX de RPDC
articles.content:
Declaracion de vocero de MINREX de RPDC
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En relacion con que los esfuerzos activos y sinceros del gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea por mantener la paz duradera en la Peninsula Coreana se enfrentan con el desafio perverso de Estados Unidos, el vocero del MINREX de la RPDC hizo publica el dia 16 una siguiente declaracion:
					Como el remedio mas racional para acabar con el circulo vicioso de la tension y confrontacion que perduran durante mas de 60 anos, la RPDC presento a EE.UU. la firma del convenio de la paz entre dos paises.
					
					Esta propuesta persigue el objeto de poner fin a la politica hostil de EE.UU. a la RPDC, causa raigal de todos los problemas.
					
					Solo cuando se acaba con esa politica hostil y se eliminan las relaciones enemigas entre dos paises se implantaran la paz y la estabilidad duraderas en la Peninsula Coreana, lo que deviene la verdad innegable reconocida y simpatizada por todo el mundo.
					
					Pero, EE.UU. no acepta con sinceridad la propuesta imparcial de la RPDC, sino responde con los actos de puntualizar mas su politica hostil a la RPDC, calificada de la "estrategia fracasada".
					
					Lo muestran las maniobras de la "sancion" de EE.UU. que en los ultimos dias se perpetran de manera mas recrudescente contra la RPDC.
					
					Sigue recurriendo en los juegos de incluir atrevidamente los organos de las fuerzas armadas, la industria belica y el comercio extranjero y hasta los diplomaticos en la lista de "sancion", lo cual persigue el intento malsano de manchar la imagen internacional de la RPDC para que otros sientan crepusculos los negocios con la RPDC y asi asfixiar toda la esfera economica de la RPDC incluyendo los dominios belicos y civiles.
					
					En todas las ocasiones las autoridades norteamericanas hablan de que no tienen ningun intento hostil a la RPDC, pero, son completamente diferentes sus acciones.
					
					Al ser cautivado por el morbido sentimiento negativo a la RPDC, EE.UU. perdio totalmente la sensacion real y actua arbitrariamente sin entender nada de su contraparte.
					
					Los alborotos de "sancion" de EE.UU. haran desplegar mas el espiritu de autoconfianza y la autoestrenuidad de los obreros coreanos de la rama de la industria belica y ascender la proporcion de los productos nacionales en la industria belica de Corea.
					
					Si EE.UU. recurre invariablemente a la anacronica politica hostil a Corea, se produciran las inimaginables consecuencias totalmente contrarias a la esperanza de EE.UU.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de presidente nigeriano
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de presidente nigeriano
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje que le dirigiera el 20 de noviembre el presidente de la Republica Federal de Nigeria, Muhammadu Buhari.
					El texto va como sigue:
					
					Con motivo del IV aniversario del deceso de Su Excelencia Generalisimo Kim Jong Il, rindo el mas sublime homenaje a Su Excelencia gran Dirigente Kim Jong Il en nombre del gobierno y el pueblo de la Republica Federal de Nigeria y en el mio propio y expreso la firme solidaridad con el amistoso pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il estara vivo como el destacado Dirigente con la audaz incomparable por sus indelebles hazanas realizadas en la defensa de la causa del socialismo y la conversion de vuestro pais en el independiente.
					
					Aprovecho esta oportunidad para desearle que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre nuestros dos paises, que tienen la larga historia y tradicion se amplien y se desarrollen mas en todos los sectores.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de presidente ugandes
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de presidente ugandes
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje que le dirigiera el dia 3 el presidente de la Republica de Uganda Yoweri Kaguta Museveni.
					La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					Con motivo del 4o aniversario del deceso inesperado y triste de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il, eterno Lider del pueblo coreano, estoy recordando junto con Vd. y vuestro pueblo sus brillantes hazanas realizadas para el pueblo coreano y los demas del mundo.
					
					El dedico toda su vida de gran abnegacion para el logro del desarrollo politico, economico y social de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Sus hazanas seran eternas.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de Gennadi Andreyevich Zyuganov
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de Gennadi Andreyevich Zyuganov
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, recibio un mensaje que le enviara el dia 17 el presidente del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de la Federacion Rusa, Gennadi Andreyevich Zyuganov.
					La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					Respetado camarada Kim Jong Un,
					
					El pueblo coreano recuerda al camarada Kim Jong Il, gran Dirigente.
					
					El PTC dirige al pueblo coreano por el camino indicado por Usted.
					
					Se realizan los planes para el desarrollo en las ramas de la industria, la agricultura, la ciencia y la cultura.
					
					La Republica Popular Democratica de Corea presta atencion especial al fortalecimiento de la capacidad de defensa nacional frente a la incesante provocacion de las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					Estamos convencidos de que el pueblo coreano avanzara con toda seguridad por la senda optada por si mismo.
					
					Afirmamos la solidaridad y el apoyo a vuestro pais.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a presidente de Niger
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a presidente de Niger
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 16 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Niger, Mahamadou Issoufou, con motivo del 57o aniversario de la proclamacion de esta republica africana.
					El remitente desea al destinatario y a su pueblo mayores exitos en las labores para realizar la unidad de la nacion y el desarrollo socio-economico y expresa la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se ampliaran y se desarrollaran.
